comments.body: Is this correct? Assigning an integer constant to a bool seems wrong.
This is not assigning a value, but assigning an ID. So this is fine.

In the internal code review, @josh11b commented:

> Please document how this interacts with the isolate_session_state variable more clearly.

Please work with Josh to come up with appropriate wording here!

I feel like this is too complicated for unstructured prose. How about a bulleted list explaining which combinations of isolate_session_state, share_session_state_in_clusterspec_propagation, and clusterspec propagation lead to isolated vs. shared session state? Like:

* If share_session_state_in_clusterspec_propagation is true and clusterspec propagation is used then session state is shared independent of the value of isolate_session_state
* If ..., then ...
...

Right now you say things like: "when `share_session_state_in_clusterspec_propagation` is turned on, the `isolate_session_state` field will be forced to be true" which just seems backwards and confusing.
Okay, I'm fine with this description assuming the other reviewers agree that this description actually matches what the code does.
@josh11b The "words" is deleted now. Please review it. Thanks!
